Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller.persistence

Class PersistenceManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller.persistence.PersistenceManager
public class PersistenceManager extends Object
Handles the persistence of Phase objects. A simple filesystem-based database is used where each object will be stored as UTF-8 encoded JSON and addressable by its id (which most likely will be its game-id, see Game).

The class retrieves all the necessary information from disk, so it can be safely recreated using the same File as the root folder.

A Phase can be committed (saved to disk), pulled (retrieved and reconstructed from disk) or dropped (removed from the database).

    • commit

      public void commit(long id, Phase phase)
      Commits a new Phase to disk with the specified id.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the object
      phase - the object to save
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If phase is null
      StorageException - if there was an unpreventable IO error

    • pull

      public Phase pull(long id)
      Pulls the Phase object with the given id from disk.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the object to pull.
      Returns:
      the reconstructed object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is no record with the given id
      IllegalStateException - if the object read from disk is not consistent with the program state
      com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - if the object read from disk is not a valid Phase or a subclass
      StorageException - if there was an unpreventable IO error

    • pull

      private Phase pull(File file)
      Pulls the Phase object from the given File
      Parameters:
      file - the File to read
      Returns:
      the reconstructed object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is no record with the given id
      IllegalStateException - if the database has been corrupted
      com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - if the object read from disk is not a valid Phase or a subclass
      StorageException - if there was an unpreventable IO error
